constants.description: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a pair of bodies has to move before their collision status has to be recalculated.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_RECYCLE_RADIUS

constants.description: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can be from another before they are considered separated.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_CONTACT_MAX_SEPARATION

constants.description: Constant to set/get the maximum distance a shape can penetrate another shape before it is considered a collision.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_BODY_MAX_ALLOWED_PENETRATION

constants.description: Constant to set/get the linear velocity threshold. Bodies slower than this will be marked as potentially inactive.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_BODY_LINEAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_TRESHOLD

constants.description: Constant to set/get the angular velocity threshold. Bodies slower than this will be marked as potentially inactive.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_BODY_ANGULAR_VELOCITY_SLEEP_TRESHOLD

constants.description: Constant to set/get the maximum time of activity. A body marked as potentially inactive for both linear and angular velocity will be put to sleep after this time.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_BODY_TIME_TO_SLEEP

constants.description: Constant to set/get the default solver bias for all physics constraints. A solver bias is a factor controlling how much two objects "rebound", after violating a constraint, to avoid leaving them in that state because of numerical imprecision.
constants.name: SPACE_PARAM_CONSTRAINT_DEFAULT_BIAS

constants.description: This is the constant for creating line shapes. A line shape is an infinite line with an origin point, and a normal. Thus, it can be used for front/behind checks.
constants.name: SHAPE_LINE

constants.description: This is the constant for creating segment shapes. A segment shape is a line from a point A to a point B. It can be checked for intersections.
constants.name: SHAPE_SEGMENT

constants.description: This is the constant for creating circle shapes. A circle shape only has a radius. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.
constants.name: SHAPE_CIRCLE

constants.description: This is the constant for creating rectangle shapes. A rectangle shape is defined by a width and a height. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.
constants.name: SHAPE_RECTANGLE

constants.description: This is the constant for creating capsule shapes. A capsule shape is defined by a radius and a length. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks.
constants.name: SHAPE_CAPSULE

constants.description: This is the constant for creating convex polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections and inside/outside checks. Unlike the method [method CollisionPolygon2D.set_polygon], polygons modified with [method shape_set_data] do not verify that the points supplied form, in fact, a convex polygon.
constants.name: SHAPE_CONVEX_POLYGON

constants.description: This is the constant for creating concave polygon shapes. A polygon is defined by a list of points. It can be used for intersections checks, but not for inside/outside checks.
constants.name: SHAPE_CONCAVE_POLYGON

constants.description: This constant is used internally by the engine. Any attempt to create this kind of shape results in an error.
constants.name: SHAPE_CUSTOM

constants.description: Constant to set/get gravity strength in an area.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY

constants.description: Constant to set/get gravity vector/center in an area.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_VECTOR

constants.description: Constant to set/get whether the gravity vector of an area is a direction, or a center point.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_IS_POINT

constants.description: Constant to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity of an area. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE

constants.description: This constant was used to set/get the falloff factor for point gravity. It has been superseded by AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_DISTANCE_SCALE.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_GRAVITY_POINT_ATTENUATION

constants.description: Constant to set/get the linear dampening factor of an area.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP

constants.description: Constant to set/get the angular dampening factor of an area.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP

constants.description: Constant to set/get the priority (order of processing) of an area.
constants.name: AREA_PARAM_PRIORITY

constants.description: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.
constants.name: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED

constants.description: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.
constants.name: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE

constants.description: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.
constants.name: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE

constants.description: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.
constants.name: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE

constants.description: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.
constants.name: AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE

constants.description: Constant for rigid bodies in character mode. In this mode, a body can not rotate, and only its linear velocity is affected by physics.
constants.name: BODY_MODE_CHARACTER

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's bounce factor.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_BOUNCE

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's friction.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_FRICTION

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's mass.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_MASS

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's inertia.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_INERTIA

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's gravity multiplier.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_GRAVITY_SCALE

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's linear dampening factor.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_LINEAR_DAMP

constants.description: Constant to set/get a body's angular dampening factor.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_ANGULAR_DAMP

constants.description: This is the last ID for body parameters. Any attempt to set this property is ignored. Any attempt to get it returns 0.
constants.name: BODY_PARAM_MAX

constants.description: Constant to set/get the current transform matrix of the body.
constants.name: BODY_STATE_TRANSFORM

constants.description: Constant to set/get the current linear velocity of the body.
constants.name: BODY_STATE_LINEAR_VELOCITY

constants.description: Constant to set/get the current angular velocity of the body.
constants.name: BODY_STATE_ANGULAR_VELOCITY

constants.description: Constant to sleep/wake up a body, or to get whether it is sleeping.
constants.name: BODY_STATE_SLEEPING

constants.description: Constant to set/get whether the body can sleep.
constants.name: BODY_STATE_CAN_SLEEP

constants.description: Constant to create damped spring joints.
constants.name: JOINT_DAMPED_SPRING

constants.description: Set the resting length of the spring joint. The joint will always try to go to back this length when pulled apart.
constants.name: DAMPED_STRING_REST_LENGTH

constants.description: Set the stiffness of the spring joint. The joint applies a force equal to the stiffness times the distance from its resting length.
constants.name: DAMPED_STRING_STIFFNESS

constants.description: Set the damping ratio of the spring joint. A value of 0 indicates an undamped spring, while 1 causes the system to reach equilibrium as fast as possible (critical damping).
constants.name: DAMPED_STRING_DAMPING

constants.description: Disables continuous collision detection. This is the fastest way to detect body collisions, but can miss small, fast-moving objects.
constants.name: CCD_MODE_DISABLED

constants.description: Enables continuous collision detection by raycasting. It is faster than shapecasting, but less precise.
constants.name: CCD_MODE_CAST_RAY

constants.description: Enables continuous collision detection by shapecasting. It is the slowest CCD method, and the most precise.
constants.name: CCD_MODE_CAST_SHAPE

constants.description: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object enters one of its shapes.
constants.name: AREA_BODY_ADDED

constants.description: The value of the first parameter and area callback function receives, when an object exits one of its shapes.
constants.name: AREA_BODY_REMOVED

constants.description: Constant to get the number of objects that are not sleeping.
constants.name: INFO_ACTIVE_OBJECTS

constants.description: Constant to get the number of possible collisions.
constants.name: INFO_COLLISION_PAIRS

constants.description: Constant to get the number of space regions where a collision could occur.
constants.name: INFO_ISLAND_COUNT

Physics2DServer.name: Physics2DServer

Tree.brief_description: Control to show a tree of items.

methods.description: Clear the tree. This erases all of the items.
methods.name: clear

methods.description: Create an item in the tree and add it as the last child of [code]parent[/code]. If parent is not given, it will be added as the last child of the root, or it'll the be the root itself if the tree is empty.
methods.name: create_item

methods.description: Get the root item of the tree.
methods.name: get_root

methods.description: Set the minimum width of a column.
methods.name: set_column_min_width

methods.description: Set whether a column will have the "Expand" flag of [Control].
methods.name: set_column_expand

methods.description: Get the width of the given column in pixels.
methods.name: get_column_width

methods.description: Set whether the root of the tree should be hidden.
methods.name: set_hide_root

methods.description: Get the next selected item after the given one.
methods.name: get_next_selected

methods.description: Get the currently selected item.
methods.name: get_selected

methods.description: Get the column number of the current selection.
methods.name: get_selected_column

methods.description: Get the index of the last pressed button.
methods.name: get_pressed_button

methods.description: Set the selection mode. Use one of the [code]SELECT_*[/code] constants.
methods.name: set_select_mode

methods.description: Set the amount of columns.
methods.name: set_columns

methods.description: Get the amount of columns.
methods.name: get_columns

methods.description: Get the current edited item. This is only available for custom cell mode.
methods.name: get_edited

methods.description: Get the column of the cell for the current edited icon. This is only available for custom cell mode.
methods.name: get_edited_column

methods.description: Get the rectangle for custom popups. Helper to create custom cell controls that display a popup. See [method TreeItem.set_cell_mode].
methods.name: get_custom_popup_rect

methods.description: Get the rectangle area of the the specified item. If column is specified, only get the position and size of that column, otherwise get the rectangle containing all columns.
methods.name: get_item_area_rect

methods.description: Get the tree item at the specified position (relative to the tree origin position).
methods.name: get_item_at_pos

methods.description: Get the column index under the given point.
methods.name: get_column_at_pos

methods.description: Make the current selected item visible. This will scroll the tree to make sure the selected item is in sight.
methods.name: ensure_cursor_is_visible

methods.description: Set whether the column titles visibility.
methods.name: set_column_titles_visible

methods.description: Get whether the column titles are being shown.
methods.name: are_column_titles_visible

methods.description: Set the title of a column.
methods.name: set_column_title

methods.description: Get the title of the given column.
methods.name: get_column_title

methods.description: Get the current scrolling position.
methods.name: get_scroll

methods.description: Set whether the folding arrow should be hidden.
methods.name: set_hide_folding

methods.description: Get whether the folding arrow is hidden.
methods.name: is_folding_hidden

methods.description: Set the drop mode as an OR combination of flags. See [code]DROP_MODE_*[/code] constants.
methods.name: set_drop_mode_flags

methods.description: Get the flags of the current drop mode.
methods.name: get_drop_mode_flags

methods.description: Set whether or not a right mouse button click can select items.
methods.name: set_allow_rmb_select

methods.description: Get whether a right click can select items.
methods.name: get_allow_rmb_select

methods.description: Set whether the editing of a cell should only happen when it is already selected.
methods.name: set_single_select_cell_editing_only_when_already_selected

methods.description: Get whether the editing of a cell should only happen when it is already selected.
methods.name: get_single_select_cell_editing_only_when_already_selected

Tree.name: Tree

signals.description: Emitted when an item is activated (double-clicked).
signals.name: item_activated

signals.description: Emitted when a cell with the [code]CELL_MODE_CUSTOM[/code] is clicked to be edited.
signals.name: custom_popup_edited

signals.description: Emitted when an item is collapsed by a click on the folding arrow.
signals.name: item_collapsed

signals.description: Emitted when an item is editted.
signals.name: item_edited

signals.description: Emitted when the right mouse button is pressed if RMB selection is active and the tree is empty.
signals.name: empty_tree_rmb_selected

signals.description: Emitted when an item is selected with right mouse button.
signals.name: item_rmb_selected

signals.description: Emitted when an item is selected with right mouse button.
signals.name: item_selected

signals.description: Emitted when a cell is selected.
signals.name: cell_selected

signals.description: Emitted when a button on the tree was pressed (see [method TreeItem.add_button]).
signals.name: button_pressed

EditorResourcePreview.brief_description: Helper to generate previews of reources or files.

methods.description: Queue a resource file for preview (using a path). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texure (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.
methods.name: queue_resource_preview

methods.description: Queue a resource being edited for preview (using an instance). Once the preview is ready, your receiver.receiver_func will be called either containing the preview texture or an empty texure (if no preview was possible). Callback must have the format: (path,texture,userdata). Userdata can be anything.
methods.name: queue_edited_resource_preview

methods.description: Create an own, custom preview generator.
methods.name: add_preview_generator

methods.description: Remove a custom preview generator.
methods.name: remove_preview_generator

methods.description: Check if the resource changed, if so it will be invalidated and the corresponding signal emitted.
methods.name: check_for_invalidation

EditorResourcePreview.description: This object is used to generate previews for resources of files.
EditorResourcePreview.name: EditorResourcePreview

signals.description: If a preview was invalidated (changed) this signal will emit (using the path of the preview)
signals.name: preview_invalidated

methods.description: Return the texture width.
methods.name: get_width

methods.description: Return the texture height.
methods.name: get_height

methods.description: Return the texture size.
methods.name: get_size

methods.description: Return the texture RID as used in the [VisualServer].
methods.name: get_rid

methods.description: Change the texture flags.
methods.name: set_flags

methods.description: Return the current texture flags.
methods.name: get_flags

Texture.description: A texture works by registering an image in the video hardware, which then can be used in 3D models or 2D [Sprite] or GUI [Control].

constants.description: Generate mipmaps, to enable smooth zooming out of the texture.
constants.name: FLAG_MIPMAPS

constants.description: Turn on magnifying filter, to enable smooth zooming in of the texture.
constants.name: FLAG_FILTER

constants.description: Default flags. Generate mipmaps, repeat, and filter are enabled.
constants.name: FLAGS_DEFAULT

Texture.name: Texture

methods.description: Return if this input event matches a pre-defined action, no matter the type.
methods.name: is_action

methods.description: Return whether the given action is being pressed (and is not an echo event for KEY events). Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.
methods.name: is_action_pressed

methods.description: Return whether the given action is released (i.e. not pressed). Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.
methods.name: is_action_released

methods.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY, it will return false for other types).
methods.name: is_echo

methods.description: Return if this input event is pressed. Not relevant for the event types MOUSE_MOTION, SCREEN_DRAG and NONE.
methods.name: is_pressed

methods.description: Change the input event to an action event of the given name, regardless of its initial type, with the pressed status passed as argument.
methods.name: set_as_action

InputEvent.description: Built-in input event data. InputEvent is a built-in engine datatype, given that it's passed around and used so much. Depending on its type, the members contained can be different, so read the documentation well! Input events can also represent actions (editable from the project settings).

properties.description: Type of event (one of the [InputEvent] constants).
properties.name: type

properties.description: Event identifier, positive integer increased at each new event.
properties.name: ID

InputEvent.name: InputEvent

PanelContainer.description: Panel container type. This container fits controls inside of the delimited area of a stylebox. It's useful for giving controls an outline.
PanelContainer.name: PanelContainer

CollisionShape2D.brief_description: Editor-only class for easy editing of shapes.

methods.description: Set this shape's [Shape2D]. This will not appear as a node, but can be directly edited as a property.
methods.name: set_shape

methods.description: Return this shape's [Shape2D].
methods.name: get_shape

methods.description: Set whether this shape is a trigger. A trigger shape detects collisions, but is otherwise unaffected by physics (i.e. will not block movement of colliding objects).
methods.name: set_trigger

methods.description: Return whether this shape is a trigger.
methods.name: is_trigger

methods.description: Return the index of this shape inside its container [CollisionObject2D]. This can be used to directly access the underlying [Shape2D].
methods.name: get_collision_object_shape_index

CollisionShape2D.description: Editor-only class. This is not present when running the game. It's used in the editor to properly edit and position collision shapes in [CollisionObject2D]. This is not accessible from regular code.
CollisionShape2D.name: CollisionShape2D

methods.description: Lock this [Mutex], blocks until it is unlocked by the current owner.
methods.name: lock

methods.description: Try locking this [Mutex], does not block. Returns [OK] on success else [ERR_BUSY].
methods.name: try_lock

methods.description: Unlock this [Mutex], leaving it to others threads.
methods.name: unlock

Mutex.description: A synchronization Mutex. Element used in multi-threadding. Basically a binary [Semaphore]. Guarantees that only one thread has this lock, can be used to protect a critical section.
Mutex.name: Mutex

methods.description: Set the length of the ray.
methods.name: set_length

methods.description: Return the length of the ray.
methods.name: get_length

RayShape2D.description: Ray 2D shape resource for physics. A ray is not really a collision body, instead it tries to separate itself from whatever is touching its far endpoint. It's often useful for characters.
RayShape2D.name: RayShape2D

Theme.description:
Theme for skinning controls. Controls can be skinned individually, but for complex applications it's more efficient to just create a global theme that defines everything. This theme can be applied to any [Control], and it and its children will automatically use it.
		Theme resources can be alternatively loaded by writing them in a .theme file, see docs for more info.
Theme.name: Theme

Popup.brief_description: Base container control for popups and dialogs.

methods.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, at the current size, or at a size determined by "size".
methods.name: popup_centered

methods.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, scaled at a ratio of size of the screen.
methods.name: popup_centered_ratio

methods.description: Popup (show the control in modal form) in the center of the screen, ensuring the size is never smaller than [code]minsize[/code].
methods.name: popup_centered_minsize

methods.description: Popup (show the control in modal form).
methods.name: popup

methods.description: Make the popup hide other popups when shown on the screen.
methods.name: set_exclusive

methods.description: Returns whether the popup will hide other popups when shown on the screen.
methods.name: is_exclusive

Popup.description: Popup is a base [Control] used to show dialogs and popups. It's a subwindow and modal by default (see [Control]) and has helpers for custom popup behavior.

constants.description: Notification sent right after the popup is shown.
constants.name: NOTIFICATION_POST_POPUP

constants.description: Notification sent right after the popup is hidden.
constants.name: NOTIFICATION_POPUP_HIDE

Popup.name: Popup

signals.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is hidden.
signals.name: popup_hide

signals.description: This signal is emitted when a popup is about to be shown. (often used in [PopupMenu] for clearing the list of options and creating a new one according to the current context).
signals.name: about_to_show

Physics2DShapeQueryParameters.brief_description: Parameters to be sent to a 2D shape physics query.

methods.description: Set the [Shape2D] that will be used for collision/intersection queries.
methods.name: set_shape

methods.description: Set the [RID] of the shape to be used in queries.
methods.name: set_shape_rid

methods.description: Return the [RID] of the shape queried.
methods.name: get_shape_rid

methods.description: Set the transormation matrix of the shape. This is necessary to set its position/rotation/scale.

methods.description: Return the transform matrix of the shape queried.
methods.name: get_transform

methods.description: Set the current movement speed of the shape.
methods.name: set_motion

methods.description: Return the current movement speed of the shape.
methods.name: get_motion

methods.description: Set the collision margin for the shape. A collision margin is an amount (in pixels) that the shape will grow when computing collisions, to account for numerical imprecision.
methods.name: set_margin

methods.description: Return the collision margin for the shape.
methods.name: get_margin

methods.description: Set the physics layer(s) the shape belongs to.

methods.description: Return the physics layer(s) the shape belongs to.

methods.description: Set the type of object the shape belongs to (see Physics2DDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_*).
methods.name: set_object_type_mask

methods.description: Return the type of object the shape belongs to.
methods.name: get_object_type_mask

methods.description: Set the list of objects, or object [RID]s, that will be excluded from collisions.
methods.name: set_exclude

methods.description: Return the list of objects, or object [RID]s, that will be excluded from collisions.
methods.name: get_exclude

Physics2DShapeQueryParameters.description: This class contains the shape and other parameters for intersection/collision queries.
Physics2DShapeQueryParameters.name: Physics2DShapeQueryParameters

InputDefault.description: Default implementation of the [Input] class, used internally by the editor and games for default input management.
InputDefault.name: InputDefault

InputEventScreenTouch.brief_description: Built-in input event type for touchscreen drag events.

methods.description: Return if this input event matches a pre-defined action.

methods.description: Return whether the given action is being pressed.
methods.name: is_action_pressed

methods.description: Return whether the given action is released (i.e. not pressed).
methods.name: is_action_released

methods.description: Return if this input event is an echo event (only for events of type KEY, i.e. always false for this type).
methods.name: is_echo

methods.description: Return if this input event is pressed.
methods.name: is_pressed

methods.description: Change the input event to an action event of the given name with the pressed status passed as argument.

InputEventScreenTouch.description: Input event type for touchscreen drag events that extends the global [InputEvent] type.

properties.description: Type of event (one of the [InputEvent] constants).

ParallaxBackground.brief_description: A node used to create a parallax scrolling background.

methods.description: Set the base offset in pixels of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.
methods.name: set_scroll_base_offset

methods.description: Return the base offset.
methods.name: get_scroll_base_offset

methods.description: Set the base motion scale of all children [ParallaxLayer] nodes.
methods.name: set_scroll_base_scale

methods.description: Return the base motion scale.
methods.name: get_scroll_base_scale

methods.description: Set the left and top limits in pixels for scrolling to begin. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is greater than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_end, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.
methods.name: set_limit_begin

methods.description: Return the beginning limit.
methods.name: get_limit_begin

methods.description: Set the right and bottom limits in pixels for scrolling to end. If the camera is outside of this limit the background will not continue to scroll. If an axis is less than or equal to the corresponding axis of limit_begin, then it will not limit scrolling for that axis.
methods.name: set_limit_end

methods.description: Return the ending limit.
methods.name: get_limit_end

methods.description: Set to true for all child [ParallaxLayer] nodes to not be affected by the zoom level of the camera.
methods.name: set_ignore_camera_zoom

methods.description: Return ignoring camera zoom.
methods.name: is_ignore_camera_zoom

ParallaxBackground.description: A ParallaxBackground will use one or more [ParallaxLayer] nodes to create a parallax scrolling background. Each [ParallaxLayer] can be set to move at different speeds relative to the camera movement, this can be used to create an illusion of depth in a 2D game.
ParallaxBackground.name: ParallaxBackground

EditorScenePostImport.brief_description: Base script for post-processing scenes being imported.

methods.description:
This function is called upon import with the imported scene.
				Just do any changes desired to the scene and return it. If null is returned, import will fail and throw an error to the user.
methods.name: post_import

EditorScenePostImport.description: These scripts can modify scenes after being imported by the 3D Scene import option of the Import menu.
EditorScenePostImport.name: EditorScenePostImport

EditorPlugin.brief_description: Used by the editor to extend it's functionality.

methods.description:
This method is called when the editor is about to save the project, switch to another tab, etc. It asks the plugin to apply any pending state changes to ensure consistency.
				This is used, for example, in shader editors to let the plugin know that it must apply the shader code being written by the user to the object.
methods.name: apply_changes

methods.description: Clear all the state and reset the object being edited to zero. This ensures your plugin does not keep editing a currently existing node, or a node from the wrong scene.
methods.name: clear

methods.description: This is used for plugins that create gizmos used by the spatial editor. Just check that the node passed in the "for_spatial" argument matches your plugin.
methods.name: create_spatial_gizmo

methods.description: This function is used for plugins that edit specific object types (nodes or resources). It requests the editor to edit the given object.
methods.name: edit

methods.description: If your plugin is active (because handles() returned true to the object), any input interaction with the 2D canvas editor will be first forwarded here. The canvas transform (containing zoom and offset to transform to edited world coordinates) is provided, but the input supplied is in untransformed coordinates to the canvas editor. Return true if you want to eat this event and not pass it to the canvas editor.
methods.name: forward_canvas_input_event

methods.description: This function is called every time the 2D canvas editor draws (which overlays over the edited scene). Drawing over the supplied control will draw over the edited scene. To convert from control coordinates to edited scene coordinates (including zoom and offset), a transform is also provided. If you require this control to be redraw, call [method update_canvas].
methods.name: forward_draw_over_canvas

methods.description:
This is a low level function for plugins that edit a given objet type derived from Spatial to capture the input of the viewport. The function is only being called if your object is being edited.
				By using the [InputEvent] and the [Camera] arguments it's pretty easy to do raycasts into space using Camera functions.
				Return true if you want to capture the input, otherwise false.
methods.name: forward_spatial_input_event

methods.description: This is for editors that edit script based objects. You can return a list of breakpoints in the format (script:line), for example: res://path_to_script.gd:25
methods.name: get_breakpoints

methods.description: Get the name of the editor plugin. For main scren plugins this is what will appear in the selector (which by default is 2D, 3D, Script).
methods.name: get_name

methods.description: Get the state of your plugin editor. This is used when saving the scene (so state is kept when opening it again) and for switching tabs (so state can be restored when the tab returns).
methods.name: get_state

methods.description: Get the GUI layout of the plugin. This is used to save the project's editor layout when the [method EditorPlugin.queue_save_layout] is called or the editor layout was changed(For example changing the position of a dock).
methods.name: get_window_layout

methods.description: Implement this function if your plugin edits a specific type of object (Resource or Node). If you return true, then you will get the functions [method EditorPlugin.edit] and [method EditorPlugin.make_visible] called when the editor requests them.
methods.name: handles

methods.description: Return true if this is a main screen editor plugin (it goes in the main screen selector together with 2D, 3D, Script).
methods.name: has_main_screen

methods.description:
This function will be called when the editor is requested to become visible. It is used for plugins that edit a specific object type.
				Remember that you have to manage the visibility of all your editor controls manually.
methods.name: make_visible

methods.description: This method is called after the editor save the project or when the it's closed. It asks the plugin to save edited external scenes/resources.
methods.name: save_external_data

methods.description: Restore the state saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_state].
methods.name: set_state

methods.description: Restore the plugin GUI layout saved by [method EditorPlugin.get_window_layout].
methods.name: set_window_layout

methods.description:
Add a custom control to a container (see CONTAINER_* enum). There are many locations where custom controls can be added in the editor UI.
				Please remember that you have to manage the visibility of your custom controls yourself (and likely hide it after adding it).
				If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your custom controls too.
methods.name: add_control_to_container

methods.description: Add a control to the bottom panel (together with Output, Debug, Animation, etc). Returns a reference to the button added. It's up to you to hide/show the button when needed. If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_bottom_panel].
methods.name: add_control_to_bottom_panel

methods.description:
Add the control to a specific dock slot (see DOCK_* enum for options).
				If the dock is repositioned and as long as the plugin is active, the editor will save the dock position on further sessions.
				If your plugin is being removed, also make sure to remove your control by calling [method remove_control_from_docks].
methods.name: add_control_to_dock

methods.description: Remove the control from the dock. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can save the layout and remove it cleanly.
methods.name: remove_control_from_docks

methods.description: Remove the control from the bottom panel. Don't forget to call this if you added one, so the editor can remove it cleanly.
methods.name: remove_control_from_bottom_panel

methods.description:
Add a custom type, which will appear in the list of nodes or resources. An icon can be optionally passed.
				When given node or resource is selected, the base type will be instanced (ie, "Spatial", "Control", "Resource"), then the script will be loaded and set to this object.
				You can use the [method EditorPlugin.handles] to check if your custom object is being edited by checking the script or using 'extends' keyword.
				During run-time, this will be a simple object with a script so this function does not need to be called then.
methods.name: add_custom_type

methods.description: Remove a custom type added by [method EditorPlugin.add_custom_type]
methods.name: remove_custom_type

methods.description: Get the main editor control. Use this as a parent for main screens.
methods.name: get_editor_viewport

methods.description:
Add an import plugin. These plugins manage importing external content (from outside the project) into formats the engine can understand.
				On exit, don't forget to remove the plugin by calling [method remove_import_plugin]
methods.name: add_import_plugin

methods.description: Remove the import plugin, don't forget to call this on exit.
methods.name: remove_import_plugin

methods.description: Add an export plugin. Plugins of this kind can change files being exported. On exit don't forget to call [method remove_export_plugin].
methods.name: add_export_plugin

methods.description: Remove the export plugin, don't forget to call this on exit.
methods.name: remove_export_plugin

methods.description: Get tool for generating resource previews.
methods.name: get_resource_previewer

methods.description: Get the filesystem cache for all resources in the project.
methods.name: get_resource_filesystem

methods.description: Inspect an object in the inspector.
methods.name: inspect_object

methods.description: Updates the control used to draw the edited scene over the 2D canvas. This is used together with [method forward_canvas_input_event].
methods.name: update_canvas

methods.description: Get a base control where it's safe to place dialogs. Many plugins open dialogs and they need a control as a base to make sure they use the editor icons and theme.
methods.name: get_base_control

methods.description: Get the undo/redo object. Most actions in the editor can be undoable, so use this object to make sure this happens when it's worth it.
methods.name: get_undo_redo

methods.description: Get the object that handles the selection of nodes in the Scene Tree editor.
methods.name: get_selection

methods.description: Get the general settings for the editor (the same window that appears in the Settings menu).
methods.name: get_editor_settings

methods.description: Queue save the project's editor layout.
methods.name: queue_save_layout

EditorPlugin.description: Plugins are used by the editor to extend functionality. The most common types of plugins are those which edit a given node or resource type, import plugins and export plugins.
EditorPlugin.name: EditorPlugin

methods.name: insert

methods.name: invert

methods.description: Remove an element from the array by index.
methods.name: remove

methods.name: resize

methods.description: Return the size of the array.

VisibilityEnabler2D.brief_description: Enable certain nodes only when visible.

methods.description: Set an enabler to true for all nodes of its type to be disabled when the VisibilityEnabler2D is not in view. See the constants for enablers and what they affect.
methods.name: set_enabler

methods.description: Returns whether the specified enabler was set to true or not.
methods.name: is_enabler_enabled

VisibilityEnabler2D.description: The VisibilityEnabler2D will disable [RigidBody2D], [AnimationPlayer], and other nodes when they are not visible. It will only affect other nodes within the same scene as the VisibilityEnabler2D itself.

constants.description: This enabler will stop the parent's _process function.
constants.name: ENABLER_PARENT_PROCESS

constants.description: This enabler will stop the parent's _fixed_process function.

RayCast.brief_description: Query the closest object intersecting a ray.

methods.description: Enables the RayCast2D. Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions.
methods.name: set_enabled

methods.description: Returns whether this raycast is enabled or not.
methods.name: is_enabled

methods.description: Sets to which point ray should be casted. This point is in [b]local[/b] coordinate system.
methods.name: set_cast_to

methods.description: Return the destination point of this ray object.
methods.name: get_cast_to

methods.description: Return whether the closest object the ray is pointing to is colliding with the vector (considering the vector length).
methods.name: is_colliding

methods.description: Updates the collision information in case if this object's properties changed during the current frame (for example position, rotation or the cast_point). Note, [code]set_enabled[/code] is not required for this to work.
methods.name: force_raycast_update

methods.description: Return the closest object the ray is pointing to. Note that this does not consider the length of the vector, so you must also use [method is_colliding] to check if the object returned is actually colliding with the ray.
methods.name: get_collider

methods.description: Returns the collision shape of the closest object the ray is pointing to.
methods.name: get_collider_shape

methods.description: Returns collision point. This point is in [b]global[/b] coordinate system.
methods.name: get_collision_point

methods.description: Returns the normal of the intersecting object shape face containing the collision point.
methods.name: get_collision_normal

methods.description: Adds a collision exception so the ray does not report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].
methods.name: add_exception

methods.description: Removes a collision exception so the ray does report collisions with the specified [code]node[/code].
methods.name: remove_exception

methods.description: Removes all collision exception for this ray.
methods.name: clear_exceptions

methods.description: Set the mask to filter objects. Only objects with at least the same mask element set will be detected.
methods.name: set_layer_mask

methods.description: Returns the layer mask for this ray.
methods.name: get_layer_mask

methods.description: Set the types of objects to detect. For [code]mask[/code] use a logic sum (OR operation) of constants defined in [PhysicsDirectSpaceState], eg. [code]PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_STATIC_BODY | PhysicsDirectSpaceState.TYPE_MASK_KINEMATIC_BODY[/code] to detect only those two types.
methods.name: set_type_mask

methods.description: Returns the type mask (types of objects to detect) for this ray. The value is a sum (bitwise OR'd) of constants available for [PhysicsDirectSpaceState].
methods.name: get_type_mask

RayCast.description:
A RayCast represents a line from its origin to its destination position [code]cast_to[/code], it is used to query the 3D space in order to find the closest object intersecting with the ray.

		RayCast can ignore some objects by adding them to the exception list via [code]add_exception[/code], setting proper filtering with layers, or by filtering object types with type masks.

		Only enabled raycasts will be able to query the space and report collisions!

		RayCast calculates intersection every fixed frame (see [Node]), and the result is cached so it can be used later until the next frame. If multiple queries are required between fixed frames (or during the same frame) use [method force_raycast_update] after adjusting the raycast.
RayCast.name: RayCast

Get the global settings path for the engine. Inside this path you can find some standard paths such as:

methods.description:
Add a custom property info to a property. The dictionary must contain: name:[String](the name of the property) and type:[int](see TYPE_* in [@Global Scope]), and optionally hint:[int](see PROPERTY_HINT_* in [@Global Scope]), hint_string:[String].
			Example:[codeblock]
			editor_settings.set("category/property_name", 0)

			var property_info = {
			    "name": "category/property_name",
			    "type": TYPE_INT,
			    "hint": PROPERTY_HINT_ENUM,
			    "hint_string": "one,two,three"
			}

			editor_settings.add_property_info(property_info)[/codeblock]

EditorSettings.description:
Object that holds the project-independent editor settings. These settings are generally visible in the Editor Settings menu.
		Accessing the settings is done by using the regular [Object] API, such as:
		[codeblock]
		settings.set(prop,value)
		settings.get(prop)
		list_of_settings = settings.get_property_list()
		[/codeblock]

methods.description: Move the body in the given direction, stopping if there is an obstacle. The returned vector is how much movement was remaining before being stopped.

methods.description: Return the body that collided with this one.

Additionally, this metadata can not be set with [method Object.set_meta], it must be set with [method Physics2DServer.body_set_shape_metadata].
methods.name: get_collider_metadata

methods.description: Set the collision margin for this object. A collision margin is an amount (in pixels) that all shapes will grow when computing collisions, to account for numerical imprecision.
methods.name: set_collision_margin

methods.description: Return the collision margin for this object.
methods.name: get_collision_margin

KinematicBody2D.description:
Kinematic bodies are special types of bodies that are meant to be user-controlled. They are not affected by physics at all (to other types of bodies, such a character or a rigid body, these are the same as a static body). They have however, two main uses:
		Simulated Motion: When these bodies are moved manually, either from code or from an AnimationPlayer (with process mode set to fixed), the physics will automatically compute an estimate of their linear and angular velocity. This makes them very useful for moving platforms or other AnimationPlayer-controlled objects (like a door, a bridge that opens, etc).
		Kinematic Characters: KinematicBody2D also has an api for moving objects (the [method move] method) while performing collision tests. This makes them really useful to implement characters that collide against a world, but that don't require advanced physics.
KinematicBody2D.name: KinematicBody2D

CollisionObject2D.description: CollisionObject2D is the base class for 2D physics collisionables. They can hold any number of 2D collision shapes. Usually, they are edited by placing [CollisionShape2D] and/or [CollisionPolygon2D] nodes as children. Such nodes are for reference and not present outside the editor, so code should use the regular shape API.

signals.description: This event fires only once when the mouse pointer enters any shape of this object.
signals.name: mouse_enter

signals.description: This signal triggers when an input event fires over a shape. The first parameter is the viewport where the event took place. The second holds the input event received, and the third the shape of this object where it happened.
signals.name: input_event

signals.description: This event fires only once when the mouse pointer exits all shapes of this object.
signals.name: mouse_exit

methods.description: Set the radius of the circle shape.
methods.name: set_radius

methods.description: Return the radius of the circle shape.
methods.name: get_radius

CircleShape2D.description: Circular Shape for 2D Physics. This shape is useful for modeling balls or small characters and it's collision detection with everything else is very fast.
CircleShape2D.name: CircleShape2D

Area.brief_description: General purpose area detection and influence for 3D physics.

methods.description:
Set the space override mode. This mode controls how an area affects gravity and damp.
				AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED: This area does not affect gravity/damp. These are generally areas that exist only to detect collisions, and objects entering or exiting them.
				AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. This way, many overlapping areas can combine their physics to make interesting effects.
				AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE_REPLACE: This area adds its gravity/damp values to whatever has been calculated so far. Then stops taking into account the rest of the areas, even the default one.
				AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE: This area replaces any gravity/damp, even the default one, and stops taking into account the rest of the areas.
				AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_REPLACE_COMBINE: This area replaces any gravity/damp calculated so far, but keeps calculating the rest of the areas, down to the default one.
methods.name: set_space_override_mode

methods.description: Return the space override mode.
methods.name: get_space_override_mode

methods.description: When overriding space parameters, this method sets whether this area has a center of gravity. To set/get the location of the center of gravity, use [method set_gravity_vector]/[method get_gravity_vector].
methods.name: set_gravity_is_point

methods.description: Return whether gravity is a point. A point gravity will attract objects towards it, as opposed to a gravity vector, which moves them in a given direction.
methods.name: is_gravity_a_point

methods.description: Set the falloff factor for point gravity. The greater this value is, the faster the strength of gravity decreases with the square of distance.
methods.name: set_gravity_distance_scale

methods.description: Return the falloff factor for point gravity.
methods.name: get_gravity_distance_scale

methods.description:
Set the gravity vector. This vector does not have to be normalized.
				If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.
methods.name: set_gravity_vector

methods.description: Return the gravity vector. If gravity is a point (see [method is_gravity_a_point]), this will be the attraction center.
methods.name: get_gravity_vector

methods.description:
Set the gravity intensity. This is useful to alter the force of gravity without altering its direction.
				This value multiplies the gravity vector, whether it is the given vector ([method set_gravity_vector]), or a calculated one (when using a center of gravity).
methods.name: set_gravity

methods.description: Return the gravity intensity.
methods.name: get_gravity

methods.description:
Set the rate at which objects stop spinning in this area, if there are not any other forces making it spin. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops.
				In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.
methods.name: set_angular_damp

methods.description: Return the angular damp rate.
methods.name: get_angular_damp

methods.description:
Set the rate at which objects stop moving in this area, if there are not any other forces moving it. The value is a fraction of its current speed, lost per second. Thus, a value of 1.0 should mean stopping immediately, and 0.0 means the object never stops.
				In practice, as the fraction of speed lost gets smaller with each frame, a value of 1.0 does not mean the object will stop in exactly one second. Only when the physics calculations are done at 1 frame per second, it does stop in a second.
methods.name: set_linear_damp

methods.description: Return the linear damp rate.
methods.name: get_linear_damp

methods.description:
Set the order in which the area is processed. Greater values mean the area gets processed first. This is useful for areas which have an space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLED or AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_COMBINE, as they replace values, and are thus order-dependent.
				Areas with the same priority value get evaluated in an unpredictable order, and should be differentiated if evaluation order is to be important.
methods.name: set_priority

methods.description: Return the processing order of this area.
methods.name: get_priority

methods.description: Set the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.
methods.name: set_collision_mask

methods.description: Return the physics layers this area can scan for collisions.
methods.name: get_collision_mask

methods.description:
Set the physics layers this area is in.
				Collidable objects can exist in any of 32 different layers. These layers are not visual, but more of a tagging system instead. A collidable can use these layers/tags to select with which objects it can collide, using [method set_collision_mask].
				A contact is detected if object A is in any of the layers that object B scans, or object B is in any layer scanned by object A.
methods.name: set_layer_mask

methods.description: Return the physics layer this area is in.
methods.name: get_layer_mask

methods.description: Set/clear individual bits on the collision mask. This makes selecting the areas scanned easier.
methods.name: set_collision_mask_bit

methods.description: Return an individual bit on the collision mask.
methods.name: get_collision_mask_bit

methods.description: Set/clear individual bits on the layer mask. This makes getting an area in/out of only one layer easier.
methods.name: set_layer_mask_bit

methods.description: Return an individual bit on the layer mask.
methods.name: get_layer_mask_bit

methods.description: Set whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas. Only areas need to be marked as monitorable. Bodies are always so.
methods.name: set_monitorable

methods.description: Return whether this area can be detected by other, monitoring, areas.
methods.name: is_monitorable

methods.description: Set whether this area can detect bodies/areas entering/exiting it.
methods.name: set_enable_monitoring

methods.description: Return whether this area detects bodies/areas entering/exiting it.
methods.name: is_monitoring_enabled

methods.description: Return a list of the bodies ([PhysicsBody]) that are totally or partially inside this area.
methods.name: get_overlapping_bodies

methods.description: Return a list of the areas that are totally or partially inside this area.
methods.name: get_overlapping_areas

methods.description: Return whether the body passed is totally or partially inside this area.
methods.name: overlaps_body

methods.description: Return whether the area passed is totally or partially inside this area.
methods.name: overlaps_area

Area.description: General purpose area detection for 3D physics. Areas can be used for detection of objects that enter/exit them, as well as overriding space parameters (changing gravity, damping, etc). For this, use any space override different from AREA_SPACE_OVERRIDE_DISABLE and point gravity at the center of mass.
Area.name: Area

signals.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body enters this area. The only parameter passed is the body that entered this area.
signals.name: body_enter

signals.description: This signal triggers only once when a body enters this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape of the body that entered this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.
signals.name: body_enter_shape

signals.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area enters this area. The only parameter passed is the area that entered this area.
signals.name: area_enter

signals.description: This signal triggers only once when an area enters this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.
signals.name: area_enter_shape

signals.description: This signal is triggered only once when a body exits this area. The only parameter passed is the body that exited this area.
signals.name: body_exit

signals.description: This signal triggers only once when a body exits this area. The first parameter is the body's [RID]. The second one is the body as an object. The third one is the index of the shape exiting this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the exit.
signals.name: body_exit_shape

signals.description: This signal is triggered only once when an area exits this area. The only parameter passed is the area that exited this area.
signals.name: area_exit

signals.description: This signal triggers only once when an area exits this area. The first parameter is the area's [RID]. The second one is the area as an object. The third one is the index of the shape entering this area, and the fourth one is the index of the shape in this area that reported the entering.
signals.name: area_exit_shape

methods.description: Set the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.
methods.name: set_layer

methods.description: Return the layer index, determines the draw order, a lower value will be below a higher one.
methods.name: get_layer

methods.description: Set the base transform for this layer.
methods.name: set_transform

methods.description: Return the base transform for this layer.
methods.name: get_transform

methods.description: Set the base offset for this layer (helper).
methods.name: set_offset

methods.description: Return the base offset for this layer (helper).
methods.name: get_offset

methods.description: Set the base rotation for this layer (helper).
methods.name: set_rotation

methods.description: Return the base rotation for this layer (helper).
methods.name: get_rotation

methods.description: Set rotation of the layer in degree.
methods.name: set_rotationd

methods.description: Get rotation of the layer in degree.
methods.name: get_rotationd

methods.description: Set the base scale for this layer (helper).
methods.name: set_scale

methods.description: Return the base scale for this layer (helper).
methods.name: get_scale

methods.description: Return the [World2D] used by this layer.
methods.name: get_world_2d

CanvasLayer.description: Canvas Item layer. [CanvasItem] nodes that are direct or indirect children of a [CanvasLayer] will be drawn in that layer. The layer is a numeric index that defines the draw order. The default 2D scene renders with index 0, so a [CanvasLayer] with index -1 will be drawn below, and one with index 1 will be drawn above. This is very useful for HUDs (in layer 1+ or above), or backgrounds (in layer -1 or below).
CanvasLayer.name: CanvasLayer

HSeparator.description: Horizontal separator. See [Separator]. It is used to separate objects vertically, though (but it looks horizontal!).
HSeparator.name: HSeparator

methods.description: Resolve a given hostname, blocking. Resolved hostname is returned as an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type".
methods.name: resolve_hostname

methods.description: Create a queue item for resolving a given hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 depending on "ip_type". The queue ID is returned, or RESOLVER_INVALID_ID on error.
methods.name: resolve_hostname_queue_item

methods.description: Return the status of hostname queued for resolving, given it's queue ID. Returned status can be any of the RESOLVER_STATUS_* enumeration.
methods.name: get_resolve_item_status

methods.description: Return a resolved item address, or an empty string if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [method get_resolve_item_status]).
methods.name: get_resolve_item_address

methods.description: Erase a queue ID, removing it from the queue if needed. This should be used after a queue is completed to free it and enable more queries to happen.
methods.name: erase_resolve_item

IP.description: IP contains some support functions for the IPv4 protocol. TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [StreamPeerTCP] and [TCP_Server]). IP provides hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.
IP.name: IP

VScrollBar.brief_description: Vertical version of [ScrollBar], which goes from left (min) to right (max).
VScrollBar.name: VScrollBar

methods.description: Create a new tile which will be referenced by the given ID.

methods.description: Return the name of the tile.

methods.description: Set the shape offset of the tile.

methods.description: Return the shape offset of the tile.

methods.description: Set the tile sub-region in the texture. This is common in texture atlases.

methods.description: Return the tile sub-region in the texture.

methods.description: Set a shape for the tile, enabling physics to collide with it.

methods.description: Set an array of shapes for the tile, enabling physics to collide with it.

TileSet.description:
A TileSet is a library of tiles for a [TileMap]. It contains a list of tiles, each consisting of a sprite and optional collision shapes.
		Tiles are referenced by a unique integer ID.
TileSet.name: TileSet

StyleBox.brief_description: Base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI.

methods.description: Test a position in a rectangle, return whether it passes the mask test.
methods.name: test_mask

methods.description: Set the default offset "offset" of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) for a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.
methods.name: set_default_margin

methods.description: Return the default offset of the margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum) of a StyleBox, Controls that draw styleboxes with context inside need to know the margin, so the border of the stylebox is not occluded.
methods.name: get_default_margin

methods.description: Return the offset of margin "margin" (see MARGIN_* enum).
methods.name: get_margin

methods.description: Return the minimum size that this stylebox can be shrunk to.
methods.name: get_minimum_size

methods.description: Return the "offset" of a stylebox, this is a helper function, like writing [code]Vector2(style.get_margin(MARGIN_LEFT), style.get_margin(MARGIN_TOP))[/code].
methods.name: get_offset

StyleBox.description: StyleBox is [Resource] that provides an abstract base class for drawing stylized boxes for the UI. StyleBoxes are used for drawing the styles of buttons, line edit backgrounds, tree backgrounds, etc. and also for testing a transparency mask for pointer signals. If mask test fails on a StyleBox assigned as mask to a control, clicks and motion signals will go through it to the one below.
StyleBox.name: StyleBox

Physics2DServerSW.description: Software implementation of [Physics2DServer]. This class exposes no new methods or properties and should not be used, as [Physics2DServer] automatically selects the best implementation available.
Physics2DServerSW.name: Physics2DServerSW

Joint2D.brief_description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D physics.

Joint2D.description: Base node for all joint constraints in 2D physics. Joints take 2 bodies and apply a custom constraint.
Joint2D.name: Joint2D

AnimatedSprite.brief_description: Sprite node that can use multiple textures for animation.

signals.description: Emitted when frame is changed.

ReferenceFrame.description: Reference frame for GUI. It's just like an empty control, except a red box is displayed while editing around its size at all times.
